column4: My system time is off by about 15 minutes. using CLI, how can I change/update this? Is there some command to sync with a server?
ntpdate
Lemme try that.
10 Aug 08:52:00 ntpdate[27858] : no servers can be used, exiting
you'll need to tell it which server to use, of course
I see :) where can I find a list?
i believe ntp.ubuntu.com works
Thanky.
there are also regional timeservers, possibly closer to where you are, network-wise
Understood. And everything seems to be fine now. Thanks!
glad to help
unalias ls, then try gain
bash: unalias: ls: not found
odd. how did you change the default listing then?
I was trying to backup an mysql database but forgot to specifty a file to dump it to, so the text was all up on the screen. To abort, I did Ctrl+C and now the ls is borked.
try "stty sane" and then ls
no change.
but if you open another terminal, it displays fine, right?
Yes. another terminal window is fine.
i. uh.. closed off the ssh program, restarted it, and now it works fine?
well, terminals get b0rked sometimes :) probably just easiest to start fresh in another.
haha Thanks! *facepalms*
